metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1523 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Using the TIOCLINUX ioctl request, a malicious snap could inject contentsinto the input of the controlling terminal which could allow it to causearbitrary commands to be executed outside of the snap sandbox after thesnap exits. Graphical terminal emulators like xterm, gnome-terminal andothers are not affected - this can only be exploited when snaps are run ona virtual console.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.58+18.04.1
snapd - 2.58+18.04.1
snapd-xdg-open - 2.58+18.04.1
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.58+18.04.1
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.58+18.04.1
ubuntu-snappy - 2.58+18.04.1
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.58+18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.58+18.04.1').
